title.narrative: Protection Support to South Sudanese Refugees

description.narrative: Improved lives for beneficiaries affected by war and conflct
Project targets refugees,IPD,Returness and Hos communities of all gender and ages

The Republic of South Sudan has been embroiled in an armed struggle since mid-December 2013, when tensions between the South Sudan ruling party and rival fractions led by the former Vice President, escalated into a fully blown armed conflict. Since then, various media reports estimate that close to 10.000 civilians have been killed and over 70.000 fled to Uganda and neighboring countries. The latest number of Southern Sudanese refugees in Uganda as of 4th March 2014 was 75.103 arrivals in three locations of Adjumani, Arua and Kiryandongo. According to UNHCR reports, over 300 persons are arriving per day and these largely comprise children and women. Most of the emergency support agencies are providing mainly non-food and food items. A few organizations are providing protection services including basic psychosocial care. The psychosocial situation of children and women remains of concern in the humanitarian response as described by the Minister and as noted in periodic field reports. The overall objective of the mission was to provide technical support in regard to measurement of effectiveness of intervention implemented by TPO Uganda and titled: “Protection and Psychosocial support to South Sudanese Refugee Women and Children Living in Camps in Northern Uganda.”

mailing-address.narrative: Grote Marktstraat 45, Den Haag, Zuid Holland, 2511 BH
